subtests.name: Constructing a CSSLCH with percent for the lightness works as intended.
CSSLCH.l can be updated with a percent.
Constructing a CSSLCH with number for the lightness works as intended.
CSSLCH.l can be updated with a number.
Constructing a CSSLCH with css pixels for lightness throws a SyntaxError.
Constructing a CSSLCH with degrees for lightness throws a SyntaxError.
CSSLCH can be constructed from three numbers and will get an alpha of 100%.
CSSLCH can be constructed from four numbers.
Constructing a CSSLCH with CSS.number for l, c, h or alpha throws a SyntaxError
Updating a CSSLCH with CSS.number for l throws a SyntaxError
CSSLCH.l can be updated to a number.
CSSLCH.l can be updated with a CSS percent.
Updating a CSSLCH with CSS.number for c throws a SyntaxError
CSSLCH.c can be updated to a number.
CSSLCH.c can be updated with a CSS percent.
Updating a CSSLCH with CSS.number for alpha throws a SyntaxError
CSSLCH.alpha can be updated to a number.
CSSLCH.alpha can be updated with a CSS percent.
